items.prompt: Software as a Service is also called ______.
items.explanation: SaaS stands for Software as a Service.

items.prompt: I want to pay once a year. I need the ______ plan.
items.explanation: Annual means once a year.

items.prompt: Grammar: ______ the subscription active?
items.explanation: Subscription is singular, so we use 'Is'.

items.prompt: Reading: 'The price is $10/month or $100/year'. Which is cheaper for 12 months?
items.explanation: $100 is less than $120 ($10 x 12).

items.prompt: Vocabulary: A ______ is official permission to use software.
items.explanation: A license gives you legal permission to use the software.

items.prompt: Listening (Dictation): Choose the correct sentence: 'Click the upgrade button'.
items.explanation: Upgrade means to get a better plan.

items.prompt: Grammar: We ______ have a license for this program.
items.explanation: With 'We', we use 'don't' for the negative.

items.prompt: Vocabulary: When the system pays automatically, it is ______.
items.explanation: Auto-pay is the automatic billing system.

items.prompt: Reading: 'Trial ends in 3 days. Your card will be charged $15'. What happens in 4 days?
items.explanation: After the trial, the automatic payment (charge) happens.

items.prompt: Grammar: ______ I upgrade the account?
items.explanation: We use 'Could' for polite requests.

items.prompt: Vocabulary: An ______ is a document asking for payment.
items.explanation: An invoice is a formal request for payment.

items.prompt: Listening (Dictation): 'The billing cycle starts today'.
items.explanation: Billing cycle is the period of the subscription.

items.prompt: Grammar: How much ______ the annual fee?
items.explanation: Fee is singular, so we use 'is'.

items.prompt: Vocabulary: To ______ a subscription is to stop it.
items.explanation: Cancelling stops the subscription.

items.prompt: Reading: 'Welcome to our Pro Plan. You have 5 licenses for your team'. How many people can use it?
items.explanation: The text states you have 5 licenses.

items.prompt: Grammar: ______ you send me the receipt?
items.explanation: 'Could you' is the correct polite request form.

items.prompt: Vocabulary: A ______ trial is free software for a short time.
items.explanation: A free trial allows testing without payment.

items.prompt: Listening (Dictation): 'Our software is user-friendly'.
items.explanation: User-friendly means easy to use.

items.prompt: Reading: 'Payment failed. Please update your credit card details'. What is the problem?
options: The money did not go through
items.explanation: Payment failed means the transaction was unsuccessful.

items.prompt: Grammar: The manager ______ to renew the plan.
items.explanation: Third person singular (The manager) takes 'wants'.
